titleInfo.title: Brought to the Second Municipality Police Prison.

mods.abstract: WAS BROUGHT to the Second Municipality Police Prison-- JAMES THOMPSON, a mulatto, about 52 years old, 5 feet 7 inches high, pockmarked in face ; says he is free, but supposed to be a slave. PHOEBE, a dark griffe, about 35 years old, 5 feet 4 inches high ; says she belongs to Mr. James Mitchell. CHARLOTTE, a dark griffe, about 35 years old, 5 feet 4 inches high says she belongs to Madam Veneua. JOHN, a black, about 40 years old, 5 feet 5 inches high ; says she belongs to Mr. Foster of Texas. ELIZA, a mulatress, about 12 years old, 4 feet 5 inches high; says she belongs to Madam Parrar. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WARRALL, Warden. New Orleans, March 2, 1852. mb2 1aw3w
mods.note: Mr. James Mitchell; Madam Veneau; Mr. Foster; Madam Parrar
James Thompson (52); Phoebe (35); Charlotte (35); John (40); Eliza (12)
Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
